00111     uint64_t fsyncgood                    : 1;  /**< FSYNC status                                      |         NS
00112                                                          If 1, the last frame had a correctly positioned
00113                                                                fsync pulse
00114                                                          If 0, none/extra fsync pulse seen on most recent
00115                                                                frame
00116                                                          NOTE: this is intended for startup. the FSYNCEXTRA
00117                                                          and FSYNCMISSING interrupts are intended for
00118                                                          detecting loss of sync during normal operation. */
00119     uint64_t reserved_48_62               : 15;
00120     uint64_t fsyncsamp                    : 16; /**< Number of ECLKs from internal BCLK edge to        |          NS
00121                                                          sample FSYNC
00122                                                          NOTE: used to sync to the start of a frame and to
00123                                                          check for FSYNC errors. */
00124     uint64_t reserved_26_31               : 6;
00125     uint64_t fsynclen                     : 5;  /**< Number of 1/2 BCLKs FSYNC is asserted for         |          NS
00126                                                          NOTE: only used when GEN==1 */
00127     uint64_t fsyncloc                     : 5;  /**< FSYNC location, in 1/2 BCLKS before timeslot 0,   |          NS
00128                                                          bit 0.
00129                                                          NOTE: also used to detect framing errors and
00130                                                          therefore must have a correct value even if GEN==0 */
00131     uint64_t numslots                     : 10; /**< Number of 8-bit slots in a frame                  |          NS
00132                                                          NOTE: this, along with EXTRABIT and Fbclk
00133                                                          determines FSYNC frequency when GEN == 1
00134                                                          NOTE: also used to detect framing errors and
00135                                                          therefore must have a correct value even if GEN==0 */
00136     uint64_t extrabit                     : 1;  /**< If 0, no frame bit                                |          NS
00137                                                          If 1, add one extra bit time for frame bit
00138                                                          NOTE: if GEN == 1, then FSYNC will be delayed one
00139                                                          extra bit time.
00140                                                          NOTE: also used to detect framing errors and
00141                                                          therefore must have a correct value even if GEN==0
00142                                                          NOTE: the extra bit comes from the LSB/MSB of the
00143                                                          first byte of the frame in the transmit memory
00144                                                          region.  LSB vs MSB is determined from the setting
00145                                                          of PCMn_TDM_CFG[LSBFIRST]. */
00146     uint64_t bitlen                       : 2;  /**< Number of BCLKs in a bit time.                    |          NS
00147                                                          0 : 1 BCLK
00148                                                          1 : 2 BCLKs
00149                                                          2 : 4 BCLKs
00150                                                          3 : operation undefined */
00151     uint64_t bclkpol                      : 1;  /**< If 0, BCLK rise edge is start of bit time         |          NS
00152                                                          If 1, BCLK fall edge is start of bit time
00153                                                          NOTE: also used to detect framing errors and
00154                                                          therefore must have a correct value even if GEN==0 */
00155     uint64_t fsyncpol                     : 1;  /**< If 0, FSYNC idles low, asserts high               |          NS
00156                                                          If 1, FSYNC idles high, asserts low
00157                                                          NOTE: also used to detect framing errors and
00158                                                          therefore must have a correct value even if GEN==0 */
00159     uint64_t ena                          : 1;  /**< If 0, Clock receiving logic is doing nothing      |          NS
00160                                                          1, Clock receiving logic is looking for sync */
00161 #else
00162     uint64_t ena                          : 1;
00163     uint64_t fsyncpol                     : 1;

00165     uint64_t bitlen                       : 2;
00166     uint64_t extrabit                     : 1;
00167     uint64_t numslots                     : 10;

00169     uint64_t fsynclen                     : 5;
00170     uint64_t reserved_26_31               : 6;
00171     uint64_t fsyncsamp                    : 16;

00213     struct cvmx_pcm_clkx_gen_s {
00214 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00215     uint64_t deltasamp                    : 16; /**< Signed number of ECLKs to move sampled BCLK edge   |          NS
00216                                                          NOTE: the complete number of ECLKs to move is:
00217                                                                    NUMSAMP + 2 + 1 + DELTASAMP
00218                                                                NUMSAMP to compensate for sampling delay
00219                                                                + 2 to compensate for dual-rank synchronizer
00220                                                                + 1 for uncertainity
00221                                                                + DELTASAMP to CMA/debugging */
00222     uint64_t numsamp                      : 16; /**< Number of ECLK samples to detect BCLK change when  |          NS
00223                                                          receiving clock. */
00224     uint64_t n                            : 32; /**< Determines BCLK frequency when generating clock    |          NS
00225                                                          NOTE: Fbclk = Feclk * N / 2^32
00226                                                                N = (Fbclk / Feclk) * 2^32
00227                                                          NOTE: writing N == 0 stops the clock generator, and
00228                                                                causes bclk and fsync to be RECEIVED */
00229 #else
00230     uint64_t n                            : 32;
00231     uint64_t numsamp                      : 16;
00232     uint64_t deltasamp                    : 16;
00233 #endif
00234     } s;
